item.title: What is Truth? Highlight 3
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf encourages young adults and expresses the Lord's confidence in them.

item.title: To the Singles of the Church - Highlight 2
item.description: Sister Oaks shares how she learned the importance of making the most out of any difficulties in life.

item.title: To the Singles of the Church - Highlights 1
item.description: Daily choices determine the person you will become.

item.title: We Are the Architects of Our Own Happiness - Highlight 3
item.description: Happiness is dependent upon the principles chosen to follow.

item.title: Give Us This Day Our Daily Bread - Highlight 2
item.description: (John 17:20–23) Seek Christ daily, do His will each day, and each day He will supply "daily bread".

item.title: We Are the Architects of Our Own Happiness - Highlights 2
item.description: Elder Caussé testifies of what it means to be children of God.

item.title: Things as They Really Are - Highlight
item.description: Elder Bednar warns of Satan's tactic to try and disconnect us from reality through technology.

item.title: Great Expectations - Highlight 2
item.description: President Monson assures us that when we make room in our hearts - the Lord will be by our side.

item.title: Great Expectations - Highlight 1
item.description: President Monson speaks about the importance of understanding that life usually requires multiple efforts.

item.title: Truth and Tolerance - Highlight
item.description: Living with differences is part of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: We Are the Architects of Our Own Happiness - Highlights 1
item.description: How would seeing yourself as God sees you change how you lived your life? Elder Caussé gives an admonition to seek a better relationship with God.

item.title: I Will Give Myself to Him - Highlight 3
item.description: Striving to live the gospel now will help us feel the Love of the Lord.

item.title: That We Might "Not … Shrink" - Highlight 1
item.description: (D&C 19:18) Elder Bednar elaborates on a lesson he learned from Elder Maxwell's cancer.

item.title: Our Prophet Thomas S Monson - Highlight 2
item.description: Elder Walker testifies of the blessing of having a latter-day prophet.

item.title: Our Prophet Thomas S Monson - Highlight 1
item.description: Elder Walker shares his surprise in President Monson's happy attitude.

item.title: What is Truth? - Highlight 2
item.description: President Uchtdorf assures us that we are not left alone, we can overcome deception, and we can find truth.

item.title: That We Might "Not … Shrink" - Highlight 2
item.description: (D&C 19:18) Some lessons we learn in mortality come through experience and suffering.

item.title: Have I Seen the Hand of God in My Life? - Highlight
item.description: Sister Bednar testifies of the power and benefits of the Atonement.

item.title: What is Truth? - Highlight 1
item.description: President Uchtdorf speaks of the responsibility of seeking after truth.

item.title: I Will Give Myself to Him - Highlight 2
item.description: Giving our will to the Lord is something we can do everyday.

item.title: I Will Give Myself to Him - Highlight 1
item.description: With the Lord's help we can accomplish much more than we can imagine.

item.title: Israel, Israel, God Is Calling - Highlight 1
item.description: Elder Holland speaks of our need to be "caught" doing all we can to live the gospel.

item.title: Saving Your Life
item.description: September 14, 2014: Elder D. Todd Christofferson

item.title: Be Still, and Know That I Am God
item.description: May 4, 2014: Elder M. Russell Ballard

item.title: Tuning Our Hearts to the Voice of the Spirit
item.description: March 2, 2014: Sister Linda K. Burton shares insights to help increase the listener’s ability to recognize the voice of the spirit.

item.title: What Is the Blueprint of Christ’s Church
item.description: January 12, 2014: Elder Tad R. Callister explains the spiritual blueprint the Lord used to build His church in order to best accommodate the spiritual needs of his children.

item.title: How Firm a Foundation
item.description: November 2, 2014: Elder Donald L. Hallstrom teaches how the solid foundation of the gospel will enable us to overcome any challenges encountered in life.

item.title: What Is Truth?
item.description: January 13, 2013: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: That We Might “Not . . . Shrink” (D&C 19:18)
item.description: March 3, 2013: Elder David A. Bednar speaks on steadfastness and submission to the Lord's will.

item.title: Our Prophet: Thomas S. Monson
item.description: May 5, 2013: Elder William R. Walker speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: Youth of the Noble Birthright: What Will You Choose?
item.description: September 8, 2013: Elder Russell M. Nelson teaches that the youth of the Church are to be standard bearers of the Lord, and beacons of light to attract others to Him.

item.title: I Will Give Myself to Him
item.description: November 3, 2013: Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe teaches young adults principles of controlling the natural man and giving themselves to the Lord.

item.title: We Are the Architects of Our Own Happiness
item.description: November 2012: Bishop Gérald Caussé speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: Israel, Israel, God Is Calling
item.description: September 2012: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: Stand in the Sacred Grove
item.description: May 6, 2012: Elder Marlin K. Jensen speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: What E're Thou Art, Act Well Thy Part
item.description: March 4, 2012: Elder Quentin L. Cook speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: The Unspeakable Gift of the Holy Ghost
item.description: January 8, 2012: Elder Jay E. Jensen speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: Truths Most Worth Knowing
item.description: November 6, 2011: President Boyd K. Packer speaks at the CES Devotional.

item.title: Truth and Tolerance
item.description: September 11, 2011: Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks at the CES Devotional.

item.title: To the Singles of the Church
item.description: September 11, 2011: Kristen M. Oaks speaks at the CES Devotional.

item.title: Coming to Know
item.description: May 1, 2011: Sister Rosemary M. Wixom addresses young adults and outlines four questions that will help individuals come to the knowledge of their Redeemer.

item.title: We Were the Greatest Generation
item.description: March 6, 2011: Elder L. Tom Perry encourages young adults to become the greatest generation by helping others return to their Christian faith.

item.title: Give Us This Day Our Daily Bread
item.description: January 9, 2011: Elder Christofferson instructs young adults about the importance of seeking God daily and trusting Him to provide.

item.title: Follow the Doctrine and Gospel of Christ
item.description: November 7, 2010: Elder M. Russell Ballard teaches how to remain clean from the world through obedience to the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: To Have Peace and Happiness
item.description: September 12, 2010: Elder Richard G. Scott talks about the vital blessings of the temple that strengthen and bind families together.

item.title: The Road of Life
item.description: May 2, 2010: Bishop H. David Burton talks about looking to Christ enables us to overcome life's challenges and enjoy happiness and success.

item.title: Thy Friends Do Stand by Thee
item.description: March 7, 2010: Elder Ronald A. Rasband shares the importance of making and keeping righteous friendships as we grow together in the gospel.

item.title: Preparing for Your Spiritual Destiny
item.description: January 10, 2010: Elder Neil L. Andersen discusses how persistent spiritual progression leads to a brightness of hope and eternal happiness.

item.title: The Reflection in the Water
item.description: November 1, 2009: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf, using the analogy of the ugly duckling, explains that young adults can find great purpose in knowing who they are.

item.title: Zion Is the Pure in Heart
item.description: September 13, 2009: Sister Elaine S. Dalton urges young adults to create a life filled with virtue.

item.title: Things as they really are
item.description: May 3, 2009: Elder David A. Bednar warns of the effect of using too much technology and taking for granted our physical bodies.

item.title: Seek and Attain the Spiritual High Ground in Life
item.description: March 1, 2009: Elder Hales teaches how to rise above worldly temptations and seek the spiritual high ground using the story of Lehonti from the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Great Expectations
item.description: January 11, 2009: President Thomas S. Monson speaks of the importance of four critical steps to achieve success in the race of life.

item.title: What Manner of Men and Women Ought Ye to Be?
item.description: November 2, 2008: Bishop H. David Burton speaks about what constitutes true success in life.

item.title: Lessons from Liberty Jail
item.description: September 7, 2008: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland speaks about the lessons we can learn from Liberty Jail.

item.title: Power and Protection Provided by Worthy Music
item.description: May 4, 2008: Elder Russell M. Nelson tells young adults that worthy music can provide both power and protection from spiritual and temporal degradation.

item.title: Unlocking the Door to the Blessings of Abraham
item.description: March 2, 2008: Sister Julie B. Beck discusses how we can access and attain the blessings promised to Abraham and his seed.

item.title: The Simple Truths from Heaven—the Lord's Pattern
item.description: January 13, 2008: Elder Earl C. Tingey counsels young adults regarding eternal joys of marriage and family.

item.title: The Value of Self-Esteem
item.description: May 6, 2007: President James E. Faust speaks of six keys to maintain healthy self-esteem.

item.title: Hold Fast to the Words of the Prophets
item.description: March 4, 2007: Elder Neil L. Andersen teaches of obeying and cleaving to the words of modern-day prophets.

item.title: A Reservoir of Living Water
item.description: February 4, 2007: Elder David A. Bednar discusses how we have access to the source of living water, Jesus Christ, through our study of the scriptures.

item.title: Faith and Works in a Secular World
item.description: November 5, 2006: Bishop Keith B. McMullin encourages young adults to measure their faith according to the benchmarks of choice, devotion, obedience, and service.

item.title: Gifts of the Spirit for Hard Times
item.description: September 10, 2006: President Henry B. Eyring discusses the gifts of the Spirit that the Lord blesses us with to help us endure the trials of mortality.

item.title: Beginnings
item.description: May 7, 2006: President James E. Faust teaches that all were chosen from the beginning and through repentance there is hope to receive the promise of eternal life.

item.title: Look Forward with an Eye of Faith
item.description: March 5, 2006: Elder Merrill J. Bateman instructs young adults to exercise faith as they make decisions in this pivotal time.

item.title: Withstand Every Temptation of the Devil
item.description: February 5, 2006: Elder W. Rolfe Kerr speaks on withstanding the temptations of the adversary with the help of our Savior, Jesus Christ.

item.title: Decisions Determine Destiny
item.description: November 6, 2005: President Thomas S. Monson reminds us that the events of tomorrow are determined by decisions made today.

item.title: Scriptures—More Precious Than Gold and Sweeter Than Honey
item.description: September 11, 2005: Sister Susan W. Tanner inspires young adults to search and study the scriptures to receive blessings of comfort, revelation, and testimony.

item.title: The Dedication of a Lifetime
item.description: May 1, 2005: Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches young adults about the importance of finding balance in their lives as they dedicate themselves to the restored gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Blessing of Work
item.description: March 6, 2005: Elder David E. Sorensen teaches of the honorable and eternal principle of work.

item.title: Faith and Families
item.description: February 6, 2005: Elder Russell M. Nelson encourages us to have faith that, despite the trials we encounter in this life, families are eternal and pivotal to the Lord's plan of happiness.

item.title: A Sense of the Sacred
item.description: November 7, 2004: Elder D. Todd Christofferson discusses the need to appreciate and reverence those things in our lives that we hold sacred.

item.title: Terror, Triumph, and a Wedding Feast
item.description: September 12, 2004: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland speaks of rejoicing in the future and progressing in the last days.

item.title: A Challenge to Young Adults
item.description: May 2, 2004: Elder Earl C. Tingey challenges young adults to have faith and confidence as they prepare today for a happy and successful future.

item.title: Remember Who You Are!
item.description: March 7, 2004: Sister Bonnie D. Parkin urges all to remember their worth as a child of God.

item.title: The Two Guiding Lights
item.description: February 1, 2004: Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin speaks of the life-changing principles of loving the Lord and our neighbor.

item.title: The Scriptures and the Restoration
item.description: November 2, 2003: Elder L. Tom Perry tells of the coming forth of the Bible, the Restoration, and blessings of studying the scriptures.

item.title: Life's Greatest Decisions
item.description: September 7, 2003: President Thomas S. Monson addresses young adults about decisions regarding faith, marriage, work, and following the prophet.

item.title: Young Adults and the Temple
item.description: May 4, 2003: Young Adults and the Temple - Elder Russel M. Nelson

item.title: The Instrument of Your Mind and the Foundation of Your Character
item.description: February 2, 2003: President Boyd K. Packer shares some of his life experiences to teach essential doctrines like agency, the Word of Wisdom, and the Atonement.

item.title: Becoming You
item.description: Nov 3, 2002: Becoming You - Bishop Richard C. Edgeley

item.title: Come Out of the Darkness into the Light
item.description: September 8, 2002: Elder James E. Faust instructs about how to increase spiritual light in order to make good decisions that will affect the future.

item.title: Establishing Eternal Patterns
item.description: May 5, 2002: Elder Earl C. Tingey speaks of habits and patterns that will lead to eternal happiness.

item.title: Be Strong in the Lord, and in the Power of His Might
item.description: March 2, 2002: Elder M. Russell Ballard shares six ways to protect ourselves from evil with spiritual armor.

item.title: Everything Money Cannot Buy
item.description: February 3, 2002: Sister Mary Ellen Smoot talks to young adults about spiritual, familial, and eternal treasures that money cannot buy.

item.title: Making the Right Choices
item.description: January 13, 2002: Elder Richard G. Scott discusses the importance of seeking divine help when making life decisions.

item.title: The Lord's Plan for Peace
item.description: November 4, 2001: Elder Ben Banks provides a message of hope and peace amidst life's challenges and trials.

item.title: Search the Prophets
item.description: February 4, 2001: Elder L. Aldin Porter highlights "The Family: A Proclamation to the World" and encourages all to heed the words of the prophets.

item.title: Three Gates to Open
item.description: January 14, 2001: President Thomas S. Monson talks about how we should open wide the three gates of preparation, performance, and service throughout our lives.
